availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Christopher C. Rogers (Bourbon County, Kentucky, trader)

body.p: Bourbon County, Kentucky, trader. Kentucky native. Son of William Rogers and Catherine Rogers. Married to Lou Scott Rogers in Bourbon County, Kentucky, on May 29, 1855. Father of Kate Rogers. Resident in Bourbon County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned twenty-two enslaved persons in Bourbon County in 1850. Trader in Bourbon County in 1860. Owned eight enslaved persons in Bourbon County in 1860. Household owned an additional four enslaved persons in Bourbon County in 1860. Charged with illegal gaming in Bourbon County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bourbon County, District 1, p. 310B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bourbon County, District 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bourbon County, Eastern Division, p. 681.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bourbon County, Eastern Division, p. 135B.
Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Mortality Schedules, Kentucky, Bourbon County, Paris, p. 67.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994028, Bourbon County Births.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Bourbon County Marriages, Film 000183145, p. 43.
"C. C. Rogers (1829-1880)," Find A Grave, Memorial 6353900, accessed August 14, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/6353900.
